title: Transition book from the Lightfoot administration to Mayor-Elect Johnson

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Transition book from the Lightfoot administration to Mayor-Elect Johnson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

the transition book, report, or memo that the Lightfoot administration prepared for then Mayor-Elect Johnson

the document or documents will be similar to the transition report that the Daley administration prepared for then Mayor-Elect Emmanuel: https://www.civicfed.org/sites/default/files/DaleyTransitionReport.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

title: Transition Report

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

any transition reports or memo prepared at the direction of the Lori Lightfoot administration for the incoming Brandon Johnson administration

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

title: Texas Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

While we are aware that medical copayments for incarcerated adults were suspended in 2020 and forgone in FY21, we seek clarification over whether medical fees were assessed and collected in FY22 and FY23. 
If so, we ask that you provide all reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding such fees, including the number of individuals charged for medical fees and the total amount of medical fees collected in FY22 and FY23. 
While we are aware that room and board fees are only collected for those participating in the Prison Industry Enhancement Program, we seek all current policies and procedures related to how such fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

title: Nebraska Youth Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Nebraska Public Records Act Request: Nebraska Youth Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nebraska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of fees and debt for incarcerated youth (i.e., juvenile):

All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which incarcerated youth (i.e. juvenile) and/or their parents or legal guardians are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department/office or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of youths (i.e., juveniles) charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

title: Stamford Police - FOIA Access Form

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Stamford Police - FOIA Access Form
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please be so kind as to provide copies of all completed "Freedom of Information FOI Request Form,  Version 6/20/2019 "  the Stamford Police  Records Division has processed between October 27, 2022 through February 16 , 2023. Please include all redacted versions of the requested documents.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be processed by a representative of the news media/press and made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Meehan

communications.subject: FILE NO. A23-0355: MUCKROCK (R MEEHAN) - FOI REQUEST - SPD - FOI REQUEST FORMS - 6-19 TO 5-1-23
communications.communication: We previously responded to the same request by e-mail dated 7-3-23.  Your 7-14-23 e-mail is purely for the purposes of harassment of the City of Stamford and the Stamford Police Department.

title: Public information request

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Public information request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Request to obtain the salary that was earned by Manuel Navarro-Montero  since August 2021. To include any and all bonuses received. 

The employee was arrested for alleged sex offense that occurred between a female student at Meade High School.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

M. W.

title: The Terrorist Screening Database temporary  records designated under NARA records schedule N1-065-10-012 / item 1 (Department of Homeland Security, Office of Intelligence & Analysis)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I hereby request the following records:

Any and all correspondence, reports, and documents discussing the criteria to be added to the Terrorist Screening Database and all subsets.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

1, The Terrorist Screening Database temporary  records designated under NARA records schedule N1-065-10-012 / item 1 

2, The Terror Screening Database Criteria request

3, Who is the originating agency who placed me on the (TSDB) before they are are disposed  when they have met the retention time designated in their records schedule.
because warrants granted under 18 USC 2518(8)(d) where the government must inform the person object of the warrant that his or her communications were collected via FISA Court and withholding these documents will  deny  me of my rights to a fair trail to prove my innocents.

 4, The Terror watch list

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kwmane Mays

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kwmane deon mays

communications.subject: Your Request 20232266 Has Been Accepted
communications.communication:
Good day, 
Your request: 20232266 - ALL CURRENT POLICIES REGARDING VEHICLE PURSUITS was accepted. 
The expected date of completion is: 7/25/2023. 
Best regards. 
This is an automated email, please do not reply.

communications.subject: Sparks Police Public Records Request 20232266
communications.communication:
Good afternoon:

We received your public records request 20232266 asking for all current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicle response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

Please find attached our General Orders DM 7.2 titled Emergency Vehicle Operations/Pursuit Driving.

As of this email, your PRR 20232266 is completed.

Thank you.

Delpha Rizzuto
Records Supervisor
Sparks Police Department
1701 E. Prater Way
Sparks, NV  89434
Work:  775-353-2241, Ext., 5480

communications.communication:
Please fill out our Right To know request form. Thank you! Lynn

Lynn Mohr
Elizabethtown Police Dept.
600 South Hanover Street
Elizabethtown, PA 17022
Phone: 717.367.6540 x231
Fax:     717.367.2332
This e-mail and any files transmitted with it are confidential and are intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are addressed. This communication may contain material protected by the Criminal History Record Information Act. If you are not the intended recipient or the person responsible for delivering this e-mail to the intended recipient, be advised that you have received this e-mail in error and that any use, dissemination, forwarding, printing or copying of this e-mail is strictly prohibited. If you have received this e-mail in error, please immediately notify the Elizabethtown Police Department by replying to this message and deleting it from your computer or contact us at this telephone number (717) 367-6540.

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Pelican Bay Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Your request has been received by the Tarrant County Criminal District Attorney's Office. However, it appears to have been intended for the Pelican Bay Police Department. You may submit your request to Pelican Bay by contacting the city government using the information at this link: https://cityofpelicanbay.com/

Attached to this e-mail is the most responsive document in the possession of the Tarrant County CDA regarding a pursuit policy.

Regards,

Mark Kratovil
Assistant Criminal District Attorney - Civil Division
Tarrant County Criminal District Attorney's Office
Tim Curry Criminal Justice Center, 9th Floor
401 W. Belknap
Fort Worth, Texas 76196
Phone: 817-884-1233
Fax: 817-884-1675
mckratovil@tarrantcountytx.gov<mailto:mckratovil@tarrantcountytx.gov>

Phil Sorrells
Criminal District Attorney
Tarrant County, Texas

[cid:image001.png@01D9B65C.ED782220]

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This electronic transmission and any documents or other writings sent with it may contain information that is confidential, proprietary and/or privileged. It is intended for the sole use of the intended recipient. If you have received this communication in error, please promptly notify the sender at the Tarrant County Criminal District Attorney's Office by reply email and destroy the original message. Any inadvertent disclosure does not constitute a waiver of the attorney-client privilege or any other privilege. Any disclosure, copying, distribution or the taking of any action concerning the contents of this communication or any attachment(s) by anyone other than the intended recipient is strictly prohibited.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Pittsburg Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Pittsburg Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good Morning Sydnee,

All of the City of Pittsburg Police Department’s (“Department”) policy manuals, both historical and most current, are available to the public to view and download for free on the NextRequest public records platform https://pittsburgcapd.nextrequest.com/  Click on the NextRequest link, click on Documents, in the Filter by folder field select Policy Manual, and click on Apply filters.  This will bring up all of the Department’s policy manuals, “2023 January – Pittsburg PD Policy Manual” being the most current.  You can then click on the document to view it and/or download it, free of charge.

Should you have any questions about this matter, please reach out to me.

Sincerely,

[Description: cid:image003.png@01D71A78.902EC1A0]

Cady R. Richards
Records Supervisor
Pittsburg Police Department
65 Civic Avenue
Pittsburg, CA  94565
(925) 252-4889  Fax (925) 252-4882


CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:  This communication with its contents may contain confidential and/or legally privileged information.  It is solely for the use of the intended recipient(s).  Unauthorized interception, review, use or disclosure is prohibited and may violate applicable laws, including the Electronic Communications Privacy Act.  If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender and destroy all copies of the communication.

***Please note that our City email domain has changed.  As such, my email address is now crichards@pittsburgca.gov<mailto:crichards@pittsburgca.gov>.  Please update your records.  Thank you.***

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R016631-071423
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of St. Johns County Sheriff's Office. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 119 of the Florida State Statues.  Your request was received in this office on 7/14/2023 and given the reference number R016631-071423 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: St. Johns County Sheriff's Office
SL Office
4015 Lewis Speedway
St. Augustine, FL 32084
July 14, 2023
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:
All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.
Sincerely,
Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau
View request history, upload responsive documents, and report problems here:
https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fst-johns-county-sheriffs-office-15860%252Fvehicular-pursuit-policies-st-johns-county-sheriffs-office-149240%252F%253Femail%253Djpriester%252540sjso.org&url_auth_token=AABKKjc881XQmgFE0KfUOsffg_w%3A1qKHQP%3Ae7d9DDJQ6yn06ooGE7SXZkfwQPbiHcjajLEYkCfLIzU
If prompted for a passcode, please enter:
WUWCPEUW
Filed via MuckRock.com
E-mail (Preferred): 149240-06559465@requests.muckrock.com
PLEASE NOTE OUR NEW ADDRESS
For mailed responses, please address (see note):
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 149240
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Chapter 119 of the Florida State Statues does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Records Request Center. St. Johns County Sheriff's Office

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau
